alert.note: Alert for Pleasants; Tyler (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 6:29PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Washington, central Pleasants and northwestern Tyler Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 629 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Belmont, or near St. Marys, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... St. Marys, Middlebourne, Paden City, Sistersville, Belmont, Newport, Matamoras, Friendly, Fly, Willow Island, Arvilla, Point Lookout and New Matamoras. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southeastern Ohio...and northern and northwestern West Virginia.
